body: See also #13374
Just realised that this is duplicate of #13374. @kaplanmaxe maybe incorporate above suggestions in yours?

I've tested this and found it found tons of false positives! it detected addresses in almost every message, deleting more than half the translation messages.
(for testing, it's useful to comment out `fetch_all_translations()` so it just processes the translations inthe tree.)
Makes sense because of the whitespace removal.
Closing, as  #13374 was merged.

diff_hunk:
@@ -122,6 +122,12 @@ def escape_cdata(text):
     text = text.replace('"', '"')
     return text
 
+def check_for_address(s):
+    #checks each message for bitcoin addresses
+    address_rgx='(bc1|[13])[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{25,34}'
body: nit: Can make an upper case constant with re.compile

diff_hunk:
@@ -122,6 +122,12 @@ def escape_cdata(text):
     text = text.replace('"', '"')
     return text
 
+def check_for_address(s):
+    #checks each message for bitcoin addresses
+    address_rgx='(bc1|[13])[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{25,34}'
+    return bool(re.search(address_rgx,s))
body: Probably fine to just inline (using the compiled re constant), since it is only used once
hi, delete the whitespace to make the build pass. The linter is failing.
it's in line 164
Can also install ```clang-format``` and run https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/master/contrib/devtools#clang-format-diffpy to fix any whitespaces before pushing
Note that clang format doesn't work on py files.
done..thank you

diff_hunk:
@@ -159,6 +161,11 @@ def postprocess_translations(reduce_diff_hacks=False):
                 for translation in translations:
                     if translation is None:
                         continue
+
+                    #check if btc address is included in translation
+                    if bool(re.search(ADDRESS_RE,translation)) is True:
body: Remove `is True`? Why cast to bool?

diff_hunk:
@@ -159,6 +161,11 @@ def postprocess_translations(reduce_diff_hacks=False):
                 for translation in translations:
                     if translation is None:
                         continue
+
+                    # Check if btc address is included in translation after removing whitespaces
+                    if re.search(ADDRESS_RE, translation.replace(' ', '')):
+                        translation_node.set('type', 'malicious')
+                        break
                     errors = []
                     valid = check_format_specifiers(source, translation, errors, numerus)
body:
Independent of this PR, but this bit could be simplified a fair bit:
* Return error from `check_format_specifiers`, which generates at most 1 error
* Combine loop and if not valid below

body: nit: I still like the idea of using `errors` for this.

diff_hunk:
@@ -159,6 +161,11 @@ def postprocess_translations(reduce_diff_hacks=False):
                 for translation in translations:
                     if translation is None:
                         continue
+
+                    # Check if btc address is included in translation after removing whitespaces
+                    if re.search(ADDRESS_RE, translation.replace(' ', '')):
body:
To remove all whitespaces:
```py
translation.translate({ ord(c): None for c in ' \n\t\r' })
```
or
```py
''.join(translation.split())
```
